articles.headline: In Tangled Afghan War, a Thin Line of Defense Against ISIS
articles.snippet: The Islamic State in eastern Afghanistan has survived intense pressure from American airstrikes and raids by United States and Afghan forces.
articles.abstract: The Islamic State in eastern Afghanistan has survived intense pressure from American airstrikes and raids by United States and Afghan forces.
articles.lead_paragraph: KHOGYANI, Afghanistan — When the American military dropped the largest bomb in its arsenal on an Islamic State cave complex here in eastern Afghanistan in April, the generals justified it as part of a robust campaign to destroy the group’s local affiliate by year’s end.

articles.headline: China’s New Lenders Collect Invasive Data and Offer Billions. Beijing Is Worried.
articles.snippet: Government officials are moving to curb a new generation of businesses that make personal loans online, amid concerns about privacy and rising debt.
articles.abstract: Government officials are moving to curb a new generation of businesses that make personal loans online, amid concerns about privacy and rising debt.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Bai Shichao has a debt problem that is bigger than his paycheck — and that’s a problem for the rest of China, too.
articles.byline: By Alexandra Stevenson and Cao Li

articles.headline: Business Schools Now Teaching #MeToo, N.F.L. Protests and Trump
articles.snippet: With sexual harassment rocking the business world and C.E.O.s speaking out, business schools are ripping new case studies straight from the headlines.
articles.abstract: With sexual harassment rocking the business world and C.E.O.s speaking out, business schools are ripping new case studies straight from the headlines.
articles.lead_paragraph: NASHVILLE — Tim Vogus, a professor at Vanderbilt University’s business school, was stoking the debate in his classroom one day this fall, asking first-year M.B.A. students about one of the most successful, and controversial, companies of the day. On the syllabus was Uber, a case study in both sensational business success and rampant corporate misbehavior.
articles.byline: By David Gelles and Claire Cain Miller

articles.headline: Steven Cohen Plans a New Hedge Fund. Investors Are Wary.
articles.snippet: Mr. Cohen, whose career was nearly derailed by an insider-trading scandal, is likely to open his new fund in February. It might be anticlimactic.
articles.abstract: Mr. Cohen, whose career was nearly derailed by an insider-trading scandal, is likely to open his new fund in February. It might be anticlimactic.
articles.lead_paragraph: Steven A. Cohen, the billionaire investor whose career was nearly derailed by a government crackdown on insider trading, is days away from once again being able to manage other people’s money.

articles.headline: In a Year of Nonstop News, a Batch of Business Books Worth Reading
articles.snippet: Our DealBook columnist picks his favorite business books to dive into as 2017 comes to a close.
articles.abstract: Our DealBook columnist picks his favorite business books to dive into as 2017 comes to a close.
articles.lead_paragraph: This year has been a big one for business news. But if you have some time during this holiday week to step back from the information onslaught, there are a handful of truly eye-opening business books that are worth your attention. As I do every year, I pored over dozens of books to identify several gems.

articles.headline: Coyotes Are Colonizing Cities. Step Forward the Urban Hunter.
articles.snippet: The pursuit of the predator in settings like strip malls, residential streets and parks is igniting a debate over the benefits and dangers of urban hunting.
articles.abstract: The pursuit of the predator in settings like strip malls, residential streets and parks is igniting a debate over the benefits and dangers of urban hunting.
articles.lead_paragraph: COLUMBUS, Ohio — Dennis Murphy sniffed the bobcat urine he uses to lure his prey. He checked the silencer on his AR-15 assault rifle and loaded a few snares into his Ford pickup.

articles.headline: Incomes Grew After Past Tax Cuts, but Guess Whose
articles.snippet: While the well-to-do did even better than before, average income for Americans on the bottom half of the scale actually shrank under Presidents Ronald Reagan and George W. Bush.
articles.abstract: While the well-to-do did even better than before, average income for Americans on the bottom half of the scale actually shrank under Presidents Ronald Reagan and George W. Bush.
articles.lead_paragraph: Home for the holidays after passing the eighth-largest tax cut in United States history, Republicans could be forgiven for reveling in the warm embrace of nostalgia.

articles.headline: Thousands Once Spoke His Language in the Amazon. Now, He’s the Only One.
articles.snippet: The Taushiro tribe vanished into the jungles of the Amazon basin in Peru generations ago. Amadeo García García is now the last native speaker of their language.
articles.abstract: The Taushiro tribe vanished into the jungles of the Amazon basin in Peru generations ago. Amadeo García García is now the last native speaker of their language.
articles.lead_paragraph: INTUTO, Peru — Amadeo García García rushed upriver in his canoe, slipping into the hidden, booby-trapped camp where his brother Juan lay dying.
